intro: Diellia unisora, commonly known as the single-seeded daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant produces a single seed per fruit, which is an unusual feature among its relatives. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Diellia unisora is often found in coastal and mountainous regions where it thrives in full sun.
